lines.value: :main article aromaticity the formula of benzene c 6 h 6 ) caused a mystery for some time after its discovery as no explanation had been found that could account for all the bonds - carbon usually forms four single bonds and hydrogen one
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the chemist friedrich august kekule von stradonitz was the first to deduce the ring structure of benzene
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: an often repeated story claims that after years of studying carbon bonding benzene and related molecules he dreamt one night of the ouroboros a snake eating its own tail and that upon waking he was inspired to deduce the ring structure of benzene
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however the story first appeared in the berichte der durstigen chemischen gesellschaft journal of the thirsty chemical society a parody of the berichte der deutschen chemischen gesellschaft which appeared annually in the late 19th century on the occasion of the congress of german chemists as such it is probably to be treated with circumspection
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: while his more formal claims were well publicized and accepted by the early 1920s kekule's biographer came to the conclusion that kekule's understanding of the tetravalent nature of carbon bonding depended on the previous research of archibald scott couper 1831-1892 further the austrian chemist josef loschmidt 1821-1895 had earlier posited a cyclic structure for benzene as early as 1861
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the cyclic nature of benzene was finally confirmed by the eminent crystallographer kathleen lonsdale
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: benzene presents a special problem in that to account for all the bonds there must be alternating double carbon bonds using x ray diffraction researchers discovered that all of the carbon carbon bonds in benzene are of the same length and it is known that a single bond is longer than a double bond
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in addition the bond length the distance between the two bonded atoms in benzene is greater than a double bond but shorter than a single bond
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there seemed to be in effect a bond and a half between each carbon
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this is explained by electron delocalization
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in order to visualise this one should consider the position of electrons in the bonds of benzene
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: one representation is that the structure exists as a superposition of so called resonance structures rather than either form individually
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this delocalisation of electrons is known as aromaticity and gives benzene great stability
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this is the fundamental property of aromatic chemicals that differentiates them from non aromatics
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: to reflect the delocalised nature of the bonding benzene may be depicted as a circle inside a hexagon in chemical structure diagrams as is common in diagrams of organic structures the carbon atoms in the diagram above have been left unlabeled
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: benzene occurs sufficiently often as a component of organic molecules that there is a unicode symbol with the code 232c to represent it
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: many fonts do not have this unicode character so a browser may not be able to display it correctly
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: :main article aromatic hydrocarbons many important chemicals are essentially benzene with one or more of the hydrogen atoms replaced with another functional group
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: examples of simple benzene derivatives are phenol toluene and aniline
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: examples of fused aromatic hydrocarbons are naphthalene and anthracene
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in heterocycles carbon atoms in the benzene ring are replaced with another element such as pyrazine pyridazine pyridine and pyrimidine
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: see simple aromatic ring for analogs of benzene
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: benzene may result whenever carbon rich materials undergo incomplete combustion
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it is produced naturally in volcanoes and forest fires and is also a component of cigarette smoke
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: up until world war ii most benzene was produced as a byproduct of coke production in the steel industry
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however in the 1950s increased demand for benzene especially from the growing plastics industry necessitated the production of benzene from petroleum
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: today most benzene comes from the petrochemical industry with only a small fraction being produced from coal
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: three chemical processes contribute equally to industrial benzene production catalytic reforming toluene hydrodealkylation and steam cracking
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in catalytic reforming a mixture of hydrocarbons with boiling points between 60-200°c is blended with hydrogen gas then exposed to a platinum chloride or rhenium chloride catalyst at 500-525°c and pressures ranging from 8-50 atm
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: under these conditions aliphatic hydrocarbons form rings and lose hydrogen to become aromatic hydrocarbons
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the aromatic products of the reaction are then separated from the reaction mixture by extraction with any one of a number of solvents including diethylene glycol or sulfolane and benzene is then separated from the other aromatics by distillation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: toluene hydrodealkylation converts toluene to benzene
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in this process toluene is mixed with hydrogen then passed over a chromium molybdenum or platinum oxide catalyst at 500-600°c and 40-60 atm pressure
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: sometimes higher temperatures are used instead of a catalyst
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: under these conditions toluene undergoes dealkylation according to the chemical equation :c 6 h 5 ch 3 + h 2 → c 6 h 6 + ch 4 typical reaction yields exceed 95%
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: sometimes xylene and heavier aromatics are used in place of toluene with similar efficiency
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: where a chemical complex has similar demands for both benzene and xylene then toluene disproportionation tdp may be an attractive alternative
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: broadly speaking 2 toluene molecules are reacted and the methyl groups rearranged from one toluene molecule to the other yielding one benzene molecule and one xylene molecule
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: given that demand for paraxylene p-xylene substantially exceeds demand for other xylene isomers a refinement of the tdp process called selective tdp stdp may be used
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in this process the xylene stream exiting the tdp unit is approximately 90% paraxylene
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: steam cracking is the process used to produce ethylene and other olefins from aliphatic hydrocarbons
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: depending on the feedstock used to produce the olefins steam cracking can produce a benzene rich liquid byproduct called pyrolysis gasoline
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: pyrolysis gasoline can be blended with other hydrocarbons as a gasoline additive or distilled to separate it into its components including benzene
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in the 19th and early 20th centuries benzene was used as an aftershave because of its pleasant smell
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: prior to the 1920s benzene was frequently used as an industrial solvent especially for degreasing metal
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: as its toxicity became obvious other solvents replaced benzene in applications that directly exposed the user to benzene
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: benzene was also used to initially decaffeinate coffee by german importer lugwig roselius in 1903
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this lead to the production of sanka ka for kaffein but later discontinued the use of benzene
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: as a gasoline additive benzene increases the octane rating and reduces knocking
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: as a result gasoline often contained several percent benzene before the 1950s when tetraethyl lead replaced it as the most widely used antiknock additive
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however with the global phaseout of leaded gasoline benzene has made a comeback as a gasoline additive in some nations
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in the united states concern over its negative health effects and the possibility of benzene's entering the groundwater have led to stringent regulation of gasoline's benzene content with values around 1% typical
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: european gasoline specifications now contain the same 1% limit on benzene content
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: by far the largest use of benzene is as an intermediate to make other chemicals
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the most widely produced derivatives of benzene are styrene which is used to make polymers and plastics phenol for resins and adhesives via cumene and cyclohexane which is used in nylon manufacture
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: smaller amounts of benzene are used to make some types of rubbers lubricants dyes detergents drugs explosives and pesticides
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in laboratory research toluene is now often substituted for benzene because of health concerns
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: *electrophilic aromatic substitution electrophilic aromatic substitution is a general method of substituting aromatic rings such as benzene
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: benzene is nucleophilic enough so that in the presence of strong electrophiles such as acylium ions or alkyl carbocations reaction will occur to ultimately give substituted benzenes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the friedel crafts acylation is a specific example of electrophilic aromatic substitution
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the reaction is the acylation of an aromatic ring such as benzene with an acyl chloride using a strong lewis acid catalyst
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: like the friedel crafts acylation the friedel crafts alkylation involves the alkylation of an aromatic ring such as benzene and an alkyl halide using a strong lewis acid catalyst
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the other main reaction types are aromatic nitration and aromatic sulfonation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: benzene exposure has serious health effects
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: breathing very high levels of benzene can result in death while high levels can cause drowsiness dizziness rapid heart rate headaches tremors confusion and unconsciousness
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: eating or drinking foods containing high levels of benzene can cause vomiting irritation of the stomach dizziness sleepiness convulsions rapid heart rate and death
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the major effect of benzene from chronic long-term exposure is to the blood
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: benzene damages the bone marrow and can cause a decrease in red blood cells leading to anemia
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it can also cause excessive bleeding and depress the immune system increasing the chance of infection
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some women who breathed high levels of benzene for many months had irregular menstrual periods and a decrease in the size of their ovaries
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it is not known whether benzene exposure affects the developing fetus in pregnant women or fertility in men
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: animal studies have shown low birth weights delayed bone formation and bone marrow damage when pregnant animals breathed benzene
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the us department of health and human services dhhs classifies benzene as a human carcinogen
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: long term exposure to high levels of benzene in the air can cause leukemia a potentially fatal cancer of the blood forming organs
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in particular acute myeloid leukemia aml may be caused by benzene
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: several tests can show if you have been exposed to benzene
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there is a test for measuring benzene in the breath this test must be done shortly after exposure
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: benzene can also be measured in the blood however since benzene disappears rapidly from the blood measurements are accurate only for recent exposures
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in the body benzene is metabolized
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: certain metabolites can be measured in the urine
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however this test must be done shortly after exposure and is not a reliable indicator of how much benzene you have been exposed to since the same metabolites may be present in urine from other sources
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the us environmental protection agency has set the maximum permissible level of benzene in drinking water at 0.005 milligrams per liter 0.005 mg/l
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the epa requires that spills or accidental releases into the environment of 10 pounds 4.5 kg or more of benzene be reported to the epa
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the us occupational safety and health administration osha has set a permissible exposure limit of 1 part of benzene per million parts of air 1 ppm in the workplace during an 8-hour workday 40-hour workweek
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in march 2006 the official food standards agency in britain conducted a survey of 150 brands of soft drinks
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it found that four contained benzene levels above world health organization limits
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the affected batches were removed from sale
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in recent history there have been many examples of the harmful health effects of benzene and its derivatives
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: toxic oil syndrome caused localised immune suppression in madrid in 1981 from people ingesting benzene contaminated olive oil
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: chronic fatigue syndrome has also been highly correlated with people who eat denatured food that use solvents to remove fat or contain benzoic acid
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: workers in various industries that make or use benzene may be at risk for being exposed to high levels of this carcinogenic chemical
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: industries that involve the use of benzene include the rubber industry oil refineries chemical plants shoe manufacturers and gasoline related industries
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in 1987 osha estimated that about 237000 workers in the united states were potentially exposed to benzene and it is not known if this number has substantially changed since then
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: water and soil contamination are important pathways of concern for transmission of benzene contact
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in the us alone there are approximately 100000 different sites which have benzene soil or groundwater contamination
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in 2005 the water supply to the city of harbin in china with a population of almost nine million people was cut off because of a major benzene exposure
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: benzene leaked into the songhua river which supplies drinking water to the city after an explosion at a china national petroleum corporation cnpc factory in the city of jilin on 13 november
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: currently there are some concerns about the potential for the presence of benzene in soft drinks.-->
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: they have extremely powerful jaws and sharp teeth for tearing flesh but cannot open their mouth if it is held closed hence there are stories of people escaping from the long snouted nile crocodile by holding its jaws shut
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: indeed zoologists will often subdue crocodiles for study or transport by taping their jaws or holding their jaws shut with large rubber bands cut from automobile inner tubes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: all large crocodiles also have sharp welters and powerful claws
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: they have limited lateral movement in their neck so on land one can find protection by getting even a small tree between the crocodile's jaws and oneself
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: crocodiles are ambush hunters waiting for fish or land animals to come close then rushing out to attack
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: as cold blooded predators they can survive long periods without food and rarely need to actively go hunting
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: despite their slow appearance crocodiles are the top predators in their environment and various species have been observed attacking and killing lions large ungulates and even sharks
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a famous exception is the egyptian plover which enjoys a symbiotic relationship with the crocodile
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the plover feeds on parasites that infest the crocodile's mouth and the reptile will open its jaws and allow the bird to enter to clean out the mouth
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the crocodile's bite strength is up to 3000 pounds per square inch comparing to just 100 psi for a large dog
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the largest species of crocodile also earth's largest reptile is the saltwater crocodile found in northern australia and throughout south east asia
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: crocodiles eat fish birds mammals and occasionally smaller crocodiles
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: wild crocodiles are protected in many parts of the world but they also are farmed commercially
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: their hide is tanned and used to make leather goods such as shoes and handbags whilst crocodile meat is also considered a delicacy in many parts of the world
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the most commonly farmed species are the saltwater and nile crocodiles while a hybrid of the saltwater and the rare siamese crocodile is also bred in asian farms
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: farming has resulted in an increase in the saltwater crocodile population in australia as eggs are usually harvested from the wild so landowners have an incentive to conserve crocodile habitat
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: crocodiles are more closely related to birds and dinosaurs than to most animals classified as reptiles though all of these are thought to probably be more closely related to each other than to testudines turtles and tortoises and have correspondingly unusual features for reptiles such as a four chambered heart.-->
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: spesies-spesies ieu lolobana asup kana genus crocodylus
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the two largest crocodiles in captivity are cassius at marineland melanesia on green island australia and yai a saltwater siamese hybrid
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: cassius is 18 feet 5.5m long
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: yai is listed by the guinness book of records at being 19 feet 8 inches 6 m).according to scientists there are no truly reliable records of any non prehistoric crocodiles over 22 feet 6.7m
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there is a decades old story that a crocodile killed in the bay of bengal india measured 33 feet 10m long
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a more recent measurement of its skull in the british museum crocodile skull measurements are accurate for determining body length showed the animal to have been around 17 feet 5.2 m long
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there are reports of a saltwater crocodile in australia that was 27 feet 8.2 m long but there is no evidence of this
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there is also a skull of a salt water crocodile from orissa that is very large and the animal is estimated to have been 21-23 feet 6.4 to 7 m long
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the two largest certifiable records of complete crocodile are both of 20.3-ft 6.2 m crocodiles
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the first crocodile was shot in the mary river in the northern territory of australia in 1974 by poachers and measured by wildlife rangers
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the second crocodile was killed in 1983 in the fly river papua new guinea
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in this latter crocodile it was actually the skin that was measured by zoologist jerome montague and as skins are known to underestimate the size of the actual animal it is possible this crocodile was at least another 4 inches 10 cm longer
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in the town of normanton queensland australia there is a fibreglass replica of a crocodile called krys the croc shot in 1958 by krystina pawloski a teacher taxidermist who found the reportedly 28-foot 4-inch 8.64 m animal on a sandbank on the norman river near her school outside normanton
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: data mining oge dipikanyaho salaku pangaweruh pamanggih dina database kdd nyaeta kabiasaan neangan sacara otomatis tina simpenan data nu loba keur pola
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: keur migawekeun ieu data mining make tehnik komputer tina statistik sarta pola rekonstruksi
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: data mining has been defined as the nontrivial extraction of implicit previously unknown and potentially useful information from data [1] and the science of extracting useful information from large data sets or databases [2]
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: although it is usually used in relation to analysis of data data mining like artificial intelligence is an umbrella term and is used with varied meaning in a wide range of contexts
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: used in the technical context of data warehousing and analysis data mining is neutral
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however it sometimes has a more pejorative usage that implies imposing patterns and particularly causal relationships on data where none exist
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this imposition of irrelevant misleading or trivial attribute correlation is more properly criticized as data dredging in the statistical literature
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: used in this latter sense data dredging implies scanning the data for any relationships and then when one is found coming up with an interesting explanation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this is also referred to as overfitting the model the problem is that large data sets invariably happen to have some exciting relationships peculiar to that data
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: therefore any conclusions reached are likely to be highly suspect
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in spite of this some exploratory data work is always required in any applied statistical analysis to get a feel for the data so sometimes the line between good statistical practice and data dredging is less than clear
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a more significant danger is finding correlations that do not really exist
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: investment analysts appear to be particularly vulnerable to this
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in his book where are the customers yachts
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: isbn 0471119792 1940 fred schwed jr wrote there have always been a considerable number of pathetic people who busy themselves examining the last thousand numbers which have appeared on a roulette wheel in search of some repeating pattern
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: sadly enough they have usually found it most data mining efforts are focused on developing a finely grained highly detailed model of some large data set
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in data mining for very busy people [3] researchers at west virginia university and the university of british columbia discuss an alternate method that involves finding the minimal differences between elements in a data set with the goal of developing simpler models that represent relevant data
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there are also privacy concerns associated with data mining
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for example if an employer has access to medical records they may screen out people with diabetes or have had a heart attack
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: screening out such employees will cut costs for insurance but it creates ethical and legal problems
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: data mining government or commercial data sets for national security or law enforcement purposes has also raised privacy concerns
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: [4]there are many legitimate uses of data mining
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for example a database of prescription drugs taken by a group of people could be used to find combinations of drugs with an adverse reactions
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: since the combination may occur in only 1 out of 1000 people a single case may not be apparent
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a project involving pharmacies could reduce the number of drug reactions and potentially save lives
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: unfortunately there is also a huge potential for abuse of such a database
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: basically data mining gives information that wouldn't be available otherwise
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it must be properly interpreted to be useful
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: when the data collected involves individual people there are many questions concerning privacy legality and ethics
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the a priori algorithm is the most fundamental algorithm used in data mining
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: [1] w frawley and g piatetsky shapiro and c matheus knowledge discovery in databases an overview
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: ai magazine fall 1992 pgs 213-228
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: [2] d hand h mannila p smyth principles of data mining
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: mit press cambridge ma 2001
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: [3] t menzies y hu data mining for very busy people
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: ieee computer october 2003 pgs 18-25
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.name: Sundanese

lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: & tech
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: several generalizations exist which do not require identical distribution but incorporate some condition which guarantees that none of the variables exert a much larger influence than the others
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: two such conditions are the lindeberg condition and the lyapunov condition

lines.value: other generalizations even allow some weak dependence of the random variables

lines.value: furthermore informally speaking the distribution of s n approaches the normal distribution n(nu,o 2 n as n approaches ∞

lines.value: in order to clarify the word approaches in the last sentence we standardize s n by setting is the sample mean

lines.value: for a theorem of such fundamental importance to statistics and applied probability the central limit theorem has a remarkably simple proof using characteristic functions
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it is similar to the proof of a weak law of large numbers
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for any variabel acak y with zero mean and unit variance var(y = 1 the characteristic function of y is by taylor's theorem by simple properties of characteristic functions the characteristic function of z n is but this limit is just the characteristic function of a standard normal distribution n(01 and the central limit theorem follows from the levy continuity theorem which confirms that the convergence of characteristic functions implies convergence in distribution
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: if the third central moment e((x 1 − u 3 ) exists and is finite then the above convergence is uniform and the speed of convergence is at least on the order of 1/n &frac12 see berry esseen theorem
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: pictures of a distribution being smoothed out by summation showing original distribution and three subseqent convolutions see illustration of the central limit theorem for further details on these images an equivalent formulation of this limit theorem starts with a n = x 1 + + x n ) n which can be interpreted as the mean of a random sample of size n the expected value of a n is u and the standard deviation is o n ½
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: if we normalize a n by setting z n = a n u o n &frac12 ), we obtain the same variable z n as above and it approaches a standard normal distribution
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: note the following apparent paradox by adding many independent identically distributed positive variables one gets approximately a normal distribution
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: but for every normally distributed variable the probability that it is negative is non zero

lines.value: how is it possible to get negative numbers from adding only positives

lines.value: the reason is simple the theorem applies to terms centered about the mean

lines.value: without that standardization the distribution would as intuition suggests escape away to infinity

lines.value: the density of the sum of two or more independent variables is the convolution of their densities if these densities exist
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: thus the central limit theorem can be interpreted as a statement about the properties of density functions under convolution the convolution of a number of density functions tends to the normal density as the number of density functions increases without bound under the conditions stated above
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: since the characteristic function of a convolution is the product of the characteristic functions of the densities involved the central limit theorem has yet another restatement the product of the characteristic functions of a number of density functions tends to the characteristic function of the normal density as the number of density functions increases without bound under the conditions stated above
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: an equivalent statement can be made about fourier transforms since the characteristic function is essentially a fourier transform

lines.value: :'see drugs medication and pharmacology for substances that treat patients
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this article is about medical practice tatamba mangrupa cabang tina elmu kasehatan nu musatkeun perhatian kana penyembuhan jeung perawatan health sarta wellness
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: broadly it is the practical science of preventing and curing diseases
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however medicine often refers more specifically to matters dealt with by physicians and surgeons
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: medicine is both an area of knowledge a science and the application of that knowledge the medical profession
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the various specialized branches of the science of medicine correspond to equally specialized medical professions dealing with particular organs or diseases
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the science of medicine is the body of knowledge about body systems and diseases while the profession of medicine refers to the social structure of the group of people formally trained to apply that knowledge to treat disease
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there are traditional and schools of healing which are usually not considered to be part of western medicine in a strict sense see health science for an overview
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the most highly developed systems of medicine outside of the western or hippocratic tradition are the ayurvedic school of india and traditional chinese medicine
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the remainder of this article focuses on modern western medicine
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: see the main articles history of medicine and timeline of medicine and medical technology medicine as it is practiced now is rooted in various traditions but developed mainly in the late 18th and early 19th century in germany rudolf virchow and france jean-martin charcot and others
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the new scientific medicine replaced more traditional views based on the four humours
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the development of clinical medicine shifted to the united kingdom and the usa during the early 1900s sir william osler harvey cushing
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: evidence based medicine is the recent movement to link the practice and the science of medicine more closely through the use of the scientific method and modern information science
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: genomics is already having a large influence on medical practice as most monogenic genetic disorders have now been linked to causative genes and molecular biological techniques are influencing medical decision making
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the delivery of modern health care depends not just on medical practitioners but on an expanding group of highly trained professionals coming together as an interdisciplinary team
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a full list is given on the health profession page
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some examples include nurses laboratory scientists pharmacists physiotherapists speech therapists occupational therapists dieteticians and bioengineers
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the scope and sciences underpinning human medicine overlap many other fields
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: dentistry and psychology while separate disciplines from medicine are sometimes also considered medical fields
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: physician assistants nurse practitioners and midwives treat patients and prescribe medication in many legal jurisdictions
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: veterinary medicine applies similar techniques to the care of animals
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: medical doctors have many specializations and subspecializations which are listed below
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: interdisciplinary sub specialties of medicine are
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: see also clinic hospital and hospice medicine is a diverse field and the provision of medical care is therefore provided in a variety of locations
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in addition to inpatient hospital settings medical services are often provided in locations such as clinics emergency departments endoscopy departments outpatients department operating theaters and birth suites
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: modern medical care also depends on information still delivered in many health care settings on paper records but increasingly nowadays by electronic means
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: see also the main articles medical doctor be and physician ae medical training is involves several years of university study followed by several more years of residential practice at a hospital
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: entry to a medical degree in some countries such as the united states requires the completion of another degree first while in other countries such as the united kingdom medical training can be commenced as an undergraduate degree immediately after secondary education
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: once graduated from medical school most physicians begin their residency training where skills in a speciality of medicine are learned supervised by more experienced doctors
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the first year of residency is known as the intern year
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the duration of residency training depends on the speciality
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in the usa physician training generally follows the following timeline with age of completion a medical graduate can then enter general practice and become a general practitioner or primary care internist in the usa training for these is generally shorter while specialist training is typically longer
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in most countries it is prohibited to practice medicine without a proper degree in that field and doctors must be licensed by a medical board or some other equivalent organization
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this is meant as a safeguard against charlatans
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these laws are obstacles to those who would want to pretend to training and expertise they have not earned such as practitioners of alternative medicine or faith healing
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: criticism against medicine has a long history
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in the middle ages it was not considered a profession suitable for christians as disease was considered godsent and interfering with the process a form of blasphemy
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: barber surgeons generally had a bad reputation that was not to improve until the development of academic surgery as a specialism of medicine rather than an accessory field
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: through the course of the twentieth century doctors naturally focused increasingly on the technology that was enabling them to make dramatic improvements in patients health
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this resulted in criticism for the loss of compassion and mechanistic detached treatment
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this issue started to reach collective professional consciousness in the 1970s and the profession had begun to respond by the 1980 and 1990s
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: perhaps the most devastating criticism came from ivan illich in his 1976 work medical nemesis
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in his view modern medicine only medicalises disease causing loss of health and wellness while generally failing to restore health by eliminating disease
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the human being thus becomes a lifelong patient
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: other less radical philosophers have voiced similar views but none were as virulent as illich
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: another example can be found in technopoly the surrender of culture to technology by neil postman 1992 which criticises overreliance on technological means in medicine criticism against modern medicine has led to some improvements in the curricula of medical schools which now teach students systematically on medical ethics holistic approaches to medicine the biopsychosocial model and similar concepts
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the inability of modern medicine to properly address many common complaints continues to prompt many people to seek support from alternative medicine
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: although a large number of alternative approaches to health await scientific validation many report improvement of symptoms after obtaining alternative therapies
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it is used to ease constipation and as an emetic to induce vomiting

lines.value: consumption of large amounts of castor oil below lethal doses such as one bottle can induce labor in near-term pregnant women

lines.value: it is notorious for its strong taste which was for many years a standard gag in comic strips and our gang film shorts

lines.value: in fascist italy under the regime of benito mussolini castor oil was one of the tools of the blackshirts
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: political dissidents would be force fed large dosages of castor oil by fascist thugs

lines.value: victims of this treatment would experience severe diarrhea and dehydration often resulting in death

lines.value: sometimes when the blackshirts wished to make sure that the victim would die rather than simply be badly disabled they would mix gasoline with the castor oil

lines.value: saudi arabia kabagi jadi 13 propinsi manatiq tunggal mintaqah
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: saudi courts impose capital punishment and corporal punishment including amputations of hands and feet for serious robbery and homosexuality floggings for lesser crimes such as sexual deviance e.g drunkenness
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these punishments are often carried out in public similar to the taliban in afghanistan
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: source human rights watch see ) the number of lashes is not clearly prescribed by law and varies according to the discretion of the presiding judges
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the number ranges from dozens to several thousand usually applied over a period of weeks or months
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in 2002 the united nations committee against torture criticized saudi arabia over the amputations and floggings it carries out under the shari'a
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the saudi delegation responded defending legal traditions held since the inception of islam in the region 1400 years ago and rejected interference in its legal system
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: source bbc see ).
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there is no religious freedom alcohol cannot be consumed and homosexuals are routinely persecuted
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there is no freedom of the press and critics of the government are sometimes jailed for their views
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: women are not allowed to drive and their rights to property and divorce are restricted
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the large number of guest workers present in the country are routinely subject to mistreatment as documented by human rights watch domestic workers face a wide range of grave abuses and labor exploitation including physical and sexual abuse forced confinement non payment of wages denial of food and health care and excessive working hours with no rest days human rights watch said in a new report today source hrw see ).
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the kingdom occupies eighty percent of the arabian peninsula
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: most of the country's boundaries with the united arab emirates oman and yemen are not precisely defined so the exact size of the country remains unknown
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the saudi government's estimate is 2217949 square kilometers 856356 sq mi
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: other reputable estimates vary between 2149690 square kilometers 830000 sq mi and 2240000 square kilometers 864869 sq mi
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the climate is very dry and hot
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: dry desert with great extremes of temperature and the terrain is mostly uninhabited sandy desert
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in most parts of the country vegetation is limited to weeds xerophytic herbs and shrubs
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: animals include the ibex wildcats baboons wolves and hyenas in the highlands
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: small birds are found in the oases
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the coastal area of the red sea especially the coral reefs have a rich marine fauna
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: saudi arabia has a coastline of 2640 kilometers 1640 mi
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: saudi arabia consists mostly of semi desert and desert with oases
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: almost half of the total country is uninhabitable desert with annual precipitation up to 100 millimetres 4 in in most regions
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the western regions are plateau and the east is lowland
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the southwest region has mountains as high as 3000 metres 9840 ft and is an area known for the greenest and freshest climate in all of the country
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the capital riyadh which is to the center east has an average temperature in july of 42 °c 108°f and 14 °c 57 °f in january
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in contrast jeddah on the western coast has 31 °c 88 °f in july and 23 °c 73 °f in january
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: less than 2 % of the total area is suitable for cultivation and in the early 1990s population distribution varied greatly among the towns of the eastern and western coastal areas the densely populated interior oases and the vast almost empty deserts such as the rub al khali the empty quarter the arabian desert and east sahero arabian xeric shrublands
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there are no permanent rivers or lakes in saudi arabia
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: at the time the kingdom of saudi arabia was founded in 1932 education was not accessible to everyone and limited to individualized instruction at religious schools in mosques in urban areas
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these schools taught islamic law and basic literacy skills
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: by the end of the century saudi arabia had a nationwide educational system providing free training from preschool through university to all citizens
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: while the study of islam remains at its core the modern saudi educational system provides quality instruction in diverse fields of modern and traditional arts and sciences
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this diversity helps meet the kingdom's growing need for highly educated citizens to build on its rapid progress
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: formal primary education began in saudi arabia in the 1930s
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: by 1945 king abdulaziz bin abdelrahman al saud the country's founder had initiated an extensive program to establish schools in the kingdom
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: six years later in 1951 the country had 226 schools with 29887 students
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in 1954 the ministry of education was established headed by then prince fahd bin abdulaziz as the first minister of education
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the first university now known as king saud university was founded in riyadh in 1957
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: today saudi arabia's nationwide public educational system comprises eight universities more than 24000 schools and a large number of colleges and other educational and training institutions
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: open to every citizen the system provides students with free education books and health services
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: over 25 percent of the annual state budget is for education including vocational training
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the predominant major in saudi universities is islamic studies and few saudis choose to major in medical studies or engineering
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: thus the kingdom must import a large number of doctors and engineers from other nations
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: extreme heat and aridity are characteristic of most of saudi arabia
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it is one of the few places in the world where summer temperatures above 50 °c 120 °f are common while in winter frost or snow can occur in the interior and the higher mountains
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the average temperature range in january is 8° to 20 °c 47° to 68 °f in riyadh and 19° to 29 °c 66° to 83 °f in jeddah
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the average range in july is 27° to 43 °c 81° to 109 °f in riyadh and 27° to 38 °c 80° to 100 °f in jeddah
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: precipitation is usually sparse although sudden downpours can lead to violent flash floods in wadis
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: annual rainfall in riyadh averages 100 mm 4 in and falls almost exclusively between january and may the average in jeddah is 54 mm 2.1 in and occurs between november and january
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: plants can still survive in saudi arabia mostly in the south east mountains and lowlands
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: they bloom mid march through mid may
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the plants provide food for birds and insects
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: saudi arabia has an oil based economy with strong government controls over major economic activities
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: saudi arabia claimed to be in possession of 260.1 billion barrels of oil reserves as of 2003 about 24% of the world's proven total petroleum reserves
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it ranks as the largest exporter of petroleum and plays a leading role in opec
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: moreover according to the saudi government the proven reserves increase gradually as more oil fields are discovered unlike most other oil producing countries
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it must be noted however that those figures have been contested and that saudi arabia's actual reserves may be notably lower
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the petroleum sector accounts for roughly 75% of budget revenues 40% of the gdp and 90% of export earnings
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: about 35% of the gdp comes from the private sector
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: saudi arabia was a key player in the successful efforts of opec and other oil producing countries to raise the price of oil in 1999 to its highest level since the gulf war by reducing production
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: saudi arabia announced plans to begin privatizing the electricity companies in 1999 which followed the ongoing privatization of the telecommunications company
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the government is expected to continue calling for private sector growth to lessen the kingdom's dependence on oil and increase employment opportunities for the swelling saudi population
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: shortages of water and rapid population growth may constrain government efforts to increase self sufficiency in agricultural products
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in the 90's saudi arabia experienced a significant contraction of oil revenues combined with a high rate of population growth
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: per capita income has fallen from $25000 in 1980 to $8000 in 2003 up from about $7000 in 1999
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the decline in inflation adjusted per capita income from 1980 to 1999 set a record being by far the worst such decline suffered by any nation state in history
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in 2003 the price of oil jumped to record high of 40 to 50 dollars which triggered a second oil boom
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: because of that saudi arabia's oil revenues have increased dramatically
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: saudi arabia's budget surplus has crossed $28 billion 110sr billion in 2005
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: tadawul the saudi stock market index finished 2004 with a massive 76.23 % to close at 4437.58 points
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: market capitalization was up 110.14 % from a year earlier to stand at $157.3 billion 589.93sr billion which makes it the biggest stock market in the middle east.‏ to diversify the economy saudi arabia launched a new city on the western coast with investments exceeding 26.6 billion dollars
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the city which is named king abdullah economic city will be built near al rabegh industrial city north to jeddah
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the new city where construction work started in dec 2005 includes a port which is ten times larger that the largest port of rotterdam the largest in the world and it can anchor giant ships as well as an industrial area for the sectors of petrochemicals pharmaceuticals and research
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the city which will expand along a coast of 35 km also includes an educational city a tourism zone and a financial stock market center
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: saudi arabia officially became a wto member in december 2005
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: saudi arabia is a destination for men and women from south and east asia east africa and the middle east seeking work
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: hundreds of thousands of low skilled workers from regions of the developing world migrate to saudi arabia
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: although exact figures are not known skilled experts in the banking and services professions seek work in the kingdom
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: saudi arabia's population as of 2005 is estimated to be about 26.4 million including about 5.6 million resident foreigners
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: until the 1960s most of the population was nomadic or semi nomadic due to rapid economic and urban growth more than 95% of the population now is settled
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the birth rate is 29.56 births per 1000 people
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the death rate is only 2.62 deaths per 1000 people
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some cities and oases have densities of more than 1000 people per square kilometre 2600/sq mi
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: around 80% of saudis are ethnically arab but many are of sub saharan east african ancestry
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there are some 7 million migrants from countries all around the world namely indian 1.4 million bangladeshi 1 million pakistani 900000 filipino 800000 and egyptian 750000
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: many arabs from nearby countries are employed in the kingdom
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there are around 100000 westerners in saudi arabia most of whom live in compounds or gated communities
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the saudi government states that all citizens must be muslim and there is very little religious freedom
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the majority of the population adhere to strict form of a cult within islam most commonly known as salafi or wahhabism
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however there are religious minorities such as christians and hindus who are working as temporary workers none of these minorities are allowed to have their churches or temples or pray in public
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the us state departments suggest that there are 500000 to 1 million people who adhere to the catholic christian faith
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the exit and entry visa cards ask applicants for their religious affiliation and officially bans entry to anyone with an official stamp from the state of israel
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: sports are a very popular pastime for the young men and women in saudi arabia
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: even though soccer is the most played game saudi arabia has participated in many world games such as the summer olympics volleyball basketball and other sports
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the national football team is most known for qualifying in four consecutive times in the fifa world cup and six times at the asian cup which the team won the championship three times and was runner up two times
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some popular soccer players include majed abdullah mohamed al deayea and sami al jaber
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: one of saudi arabia's most compelling folk rituals is the ardha the country's national dance
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this sword dance is based on ancient bedouin traditions drummers beat out a rhythm and a poet chants verses while sword carrying men dance shoulder to shoulder
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: al sihba folk music from the hijaz has its origins in arab andalusia a region of medieval spain
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in mecca medina and jeddah dance and song incorporate the sound of the al mizmar an oboe like woodwind instrument
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the drum is also an important instrument according to traditional and tribal customs
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: saudi arabian dress is strongly symbolic representing the people's ties to the land the past and islam
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the predominantly loose and flowing but covering garments reflect the practicalities of life in a desert country as well as islam's emphasis on conservative dress
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: traditionally men usually wear an ankle length shirt woven from wool or cotton known as a thawb with a shimagh a large checkered square of cotton held in place by a cord coil or a ghutra a plain white square made of finer cotton also held in place by a cord coil worn on the head
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for rare chilly days saudi men wear a camel hair cloak bisht over the top
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: women's clothes are decorated with tribal motifs coins sequins metallic thread and appliques
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however saudi women must wear a long cloak abaya and veil niqab when they leave the house to protect their modesty
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the law does not apply to foreigners at such a high degree but both men and women are told to dress modestly
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: islam forbids the eating of pork and the drinking of alcohol and this law is enforced strictly throughout saudi arabia
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: arabic unleavened bread or khobz is eaten with almost all meals
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: other staples include cooked lamb grilled chicken falafel deep-fried chickpea balls shawarma spit-cooked sliced lamb and fuul a paste of fava beans garlic and lemon
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: traditional coffee houses used to be ubiquitous but are now being displaced by food hall style cafes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: arabic tea is also a famous custom which is used in both casual and formal meetings between friends family and even strangers
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the tea is black without milk and has herbal flavoring that comes in many variations
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: public theatres and cinemas are prohibited as wahabbi tradition deems those institutions to be incompatible with islam
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however in private compounds such as dhahran and ras tanura public theaters can be found but often are more popular for local music arts and theatre productions rather than the exhibition of motion pictures
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: recently plans for some cinemas that will allow arabic cartoons to be featured in cinemas for women and children were announced
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: videos and dvds of popular american movies are legal and widely available
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the cultural heritage is celebrated at the annual jenadriyah cultural festival
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the work is made up of a collection of stories thought to be from traditional persian arabic and indian stories
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the core stories probably originated in an iranic empire and were brought together in a persian work called hazar afsanah a thousand legends
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the arabic compilation alf layla a thousand nights originating about 850 ad was in turn probably an abridged translation of hezar afsaneh
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some of its elements appear in the odyssey
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the present name alf layla wa layla literally a a thousand nights and a night i.e 1001 nights seems to have appeared at an unknown time in the middle ages and expresses the idea of a transfinite number since 1000 represented conceptual infinity within arabic mathematical circles
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the first european version and first printed edition was a translation into french 1704 1717 by antoine galland from an earlier compilation that was written in arabic
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this 12 volume book les mille et une nuits contes arabes traduits en francais thousand and one nights arab stories translated into french probably included arabic stories known to the translator but not included in the arabic compilation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: aladdin's lamp and ali baba and the forty thieves appeared first in galland's translation and cannot be found in the original writings
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: he wrote that he heard them from a syrian christian storyteller from aleppo a maronite scholar youhenna diab whom he called hanna
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: john payne alaeddin and the enchanted lamp and other stories london 1901 gives details of galland's encounter with hanna in 1709 and of the discovery in the bibliotheque nationale paris of two arabic manuscripts containing aladdin and two more of the interpolated tales
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: he instances galland's own experience to demonstrate the lack of regard for such entertainments in the mainstream of islamic scholarship with the result that ...complete copies of the genuine work were rarely to be met with collections and the fragmentary copies which existed were mostly in the hands of professional story tellers who were extremely unwilling to part with them looking upon them as their stock in trade and were in the habit of incorporating with the genuine text all kinds of stories and anecdotes from other sources to fill the place of the missing portions of the original work
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this process of addition and incorporation which has been in progress ever since the first collection of the nights into one distinct work and is doubtless still going on in oriental countries especially such as are least in contact with european influence may account for the heterogeneous character of the various modern manuscripts of the nights and for the immense difference which exists between the several texts as well in actual contents as in the details and diction of such stories as are common to all
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: perhaps the best known translation to english speakers is that by sir richard francis burton entitled the book of the thousand nights and a night 1885
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: unlike previous editions his ten volume translation was not bowdlerized
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: though printed in the victorian era it contained all the erotic nuances of the source material replete with sexual imagery and pederastic allusions added as appendices to the main stories by burton
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: burton circumvented strict victorian laws on obscene material by printing an edition for subscribers only rather than formally publishing the book
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the original ten volumes were followed by a further six entitled the supplemental nights to the thousand nights and a night which were printed between 1886 and 1888
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: more recent versions are that of the french doctor j c mardrus translated into english by powys mathers and notably a critical edition based on the 14th century syrian manuscript in the bibliotheque nationale compiled in arabic by muhsin mahdi and rendered into english by husain haddawy the most accurate and elegant of all to this date
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the book of one thousand and one nights has an estranged cousin the manuscript found in saragossa by jan potocki
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a polish noble of the late 18th century he traveled the orient looking for an original edition of the book but never found it
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: upon returning to europe he wrote his masterpiece a multi leveled frame tale
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there have been many adaptations of the nights for both television and the big screen with varying degrees of faithfulness to the original stories
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the atmosphere of the nights influenced such films as fritz lang's 1921 der mude tod the 1924 hollywood film the thief of bagdad starring douglas fairbanks and its 1940 british remake
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it also influenced the adventures of prince achmed 1926 the first surviving feature-length animated film
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: one of hollywood's first feature films to be based on the nights was in 1942 with the movie named arabian nights
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it starred maria montez as scheherazade sabu dastagir as ali ben ali and jon hall as harun al rashid
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the storyline bears virtually no resemblance to the traditional version of the nights
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in the film scheherazade is a dancer who attempts to overthrow caliph harun al rashid and marry his brother
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: unfortunately scheherazade's initial coup attempt fails and she is sold into slavery many adventures then ensue
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: maria montez and jon hall also starred in the 1944 film ali baba and the forty thieves
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the 1980s 1001 erotic nights starring annette haven as scheherazade and john leslie as shahryar was supposedly the first x rated movie with a million dollar budget
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the most commercially successful movie based on the nights was aladdin the 1992 animated movie by the walt disney company which starred scott weinger and robin williams
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the film led to several sequels and a television series of the same name
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the voyages of sinbad have been adapted for television and film several times the most recent of which was in the 2003 animated feature , which starred brad pitt and catherine zeta jones
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: perhaps the most famous sinbad film was the 1958 movie the seventh voyage of sinbad produced by the stop motion animation pioneer ray harryhausen
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a recent well received television adaptation was the emmy award winning miniseries arabian nights directed by steve barron and starring mili avital as scheherazade and dougray scott as shahryar
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it was originally shown over two nights on april 30 and may 1 2000 on abc in the united states and bbc one in the united kingdom
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: other notable versions of the nights include the famous 1974 italian movie il fiore delle mille e una notte by pier paolo pasolini and the 1990 french movie les 1001 nuits which starred catherine zeta jones as scheherazade
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: there are also numerous bollywood movies such as aladdin and sinbad in which the two named heroes get to meet and share in each other's adventures in this version the lamp's djin is female and aladdin marries her rather than the princess she becomes a mortal woman for his sake
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in 1888 russian composer nikolai rimsky korsakov completed his op 35 scheherazade in four movements based upon four of the tales from the arabian nights the sea and sinbad's ship the kalendar prince the young prince and the young princess and festival at baghdad

lines.value: the music is also an ironic reflection on it combining beach boys rock & roll with plunderphonics

lines.value: dina matematik aljabar borel atawa borel σ-aljabar dina ruang topologi nyaeta dua σ-aljabar sejen dina topologi ruang x a subset t of the power set 2 x of x is the smallest σ-algebra containing t the existence and uniqueness of the minimal σ-algebra is shown by noting that the intersection of all σ-algebras containing t is itself a σ-algebra containing t the elements of the borel algebra are called borel sets
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in general topological spaces even locally compact ones the two structures are different
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: they are however identical whenever the topological space is a locally compact separable metric space
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in the case x is a metric space the borel algebra in the first sense may be described generatively as follows first define for any collection a of subsets of x that is for any subset of the power set p(x of x then the borel algebra is g m for the first uncountable ordinal number m to prove this fact note that any open set in a metric space is the union of an increasing sequence of closed sets
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in particular it is easy to show that complementation of sets maps g m into itself for any limit ordinal moreover if m is an uncountable limit ordinal g m is closed under countable unions
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this alternate definition is useful for some set theoretic considerations but the minimalist definition is preferred by analysts
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a particularly important example is the borel sigma algebra or just borel algebra on the set of real numbers
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it is the algebra on which the borel measure is defined
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: given a real random variable defined on a probability space its probability distribution is by definition also a measure on the borel algebra
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the borel algebra on the reals is the smallest sigma algebra on r which contains all the intervals
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the following is one of a number of kuratowski theorems on borel spaces a borel space is just another name for a set equipped with a σ-algebra
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: borel spaces form a category in which the maps are borel measurable mappings between borel spaces where f:x > y is borel measurable iff f -1 b is borel in x for any borel subset b of y theorem
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: let x be a polish space that is a topological space such that there is a metric d on x which defines the topology of x and which makes x a complete separable metric space
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: then x as a borel space is isomorphic to one of 1 r 2 z or 3 a finite space
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it should be noted that as borel spaces r and r union with a countable set are isomorphic
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for subsets of polish spaces borel sets can be characterized as those sets which are the ranges of continuous injective maps defined on polish spaces
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: note however that the range of a continuous noninjective map may fail to be borel
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: george gaylord simpson's classic principles of classification and a classification of mammals amnh bulletin v 85 1945 was the original source for the taxonomy listed here
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: simpson laid out a systematics of mammal origins and relationships that was universally taught until the end of the 20th century
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: since simpson's 1945 classification the paleontological record has been recalibrated and the intervening years have seen much debate and progress concerning the theoretical underpinnings of systematization itself partly through the new concept of cladistics
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: though field work gradually made simpson's classification outdated it remained the closest thing to an official classification of mammals
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a somewhat standardized classification system has been adopted by most current mammalogy classroom textbooks
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the following taxonomy of extant and recently extinct mammals is taken from vaughan et al 2000
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: class mammalia
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in 1997 the mammals were comprehensively revised by malcolm c mckenna and susan k bell which has resulted in the mckenna/bell classification
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: mckenna and bell classification of mammals above the species level 1997 is the most comprehensive work to date on the systematics relationships and occurrences of all mammal taxa living and extinct down through the rank of genus
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the new mckenna/bell classification was quickly accepted by paleontologists
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the authors work together as paleontologists at the american museum of natural history new york
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: mckenna inherited the project from simpson and with bell constructed a completely updated hierarchical system covering living and extinct taxa that reflects the historical genealogy of mammalia
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the mckenna/bell hierarchical listing of all of the terms used for mammal groups above the species includes extinct mammals as well as modern groups and introduces some fine distinctions such as legions and sublegions ranks which fall between classes and orders that are likely to be glossed over by the layman
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the published reclassification forms both a comprehensive and authoritative record of approved names and classifications and a list of invalid names
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: click on the highlighted link for a table comparing the traditional and the new mckenna/bell classifications of mammals extinct groups are represented by †
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: class mammalia
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: molecular studies based on dna analysis have suggested new relationships among mammal families over the last few years
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the most recent classification systems based on molecular studies have proposed four groups or lineages of placental mammals
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: molecular clocks suggest that these clades diverged from early common ancestors in the cretaceous but fossils have not been found to corroborate this hypothesis
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these molecular findings are consistent with mammal zoogeography the first divergence was that of the afrotheria 110 100 mya
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the afrotheria proceeded to evolve and diversify in the isolation of the african arabian continent
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the xenarthra isolated in south america diverged from the boreoeutheria approximately 100 95 mya
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the boreoeutheria split into the laurasiatheria and euarchontoglires between 95 and 85 mya both of these groups evolved on the northern continent of laurasia
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: after tens of millions of years of relative isolation africa arabia collided with eurasia exchanging afrotheria and boreoeutheria
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the formation of the isthmus of panama linked south america and north america which facilitated the exchange of mammal species in the great american interchange
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the traditional view that no placental mammals reached australasia until about 5 million years ago when bats and murine rodents arrived has been challenged by recent evidence and may need to be reassessed
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it should however be noted that these molecular results are still controversial because they are not reflected by morphological data and thus not accepted by many systematists
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.name: Sundanese

lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: dua jenis manuk ieu sigana dimangsa ku protoavis texensis though the fragmentary nature of this fossil leaves it open to considerable doubt if this was a bird ancestor
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: other mesozoic birds include the confuciusornithidae enantiornithes ichthyornis and hesperornithiformes a group of flightless divers resembling grebes and loons
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the recently discovered dromaeosaur cryptovolans was capable of powered flight contained a keel and had ribs with uncinate processes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in fact cryptovolans makes a better bird than archaeopteryx which is missing some of these modern bird features
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: because of this some paleontologists have suggested that dromaeosaurs are actually basal birds whose larger members are secondarily flightless i.e dromaeosaurs evolved from birds and not the other way around
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: evidence for this theory is currently inconclusive but digs continue to unearth fossils especially in china of the strange feathered dromaeosaurs
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: although ornithischian bird-hipped dinosaurs share the same hip structure as birds birds actually originated from the saurischian lizard-hipped dinosaurs if the dinosaurian origin theory is correct and thus arrived at their hip structure condition independently
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in fact the bird like hip structure also developed a third time among a peculiar group of theropods the therizinosauridae
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: an alternate theory to the dinosaurian origin of birds espoused by a few scientists most notably lary martin and alan feduccia states that birds including maniraptoran dinosaurs evolved from early archosaurs like longisquama a theory which is contested by most other scientists in paleontology and by experts in feather development and evolution such as ro prum
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: see the longisquama article for more on this alternative
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: modern birds are classified in neornithes which are split into the paleognathae and neognathae
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the paleognaths include the tinamous found only in central and south america and the ratites
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the ratites are large flightless birds and include ostriches cassowaries kiwis and emus though some scientists suspect that the ratites represent an artificial grouping of birds which have independently lost the ability to fly in a number of unrelated lineages
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the basal divergence from the remaining neognathes was that of the galloanseri the superorder containing the anseriformes ducks geese and swans and the galliformes the pheasants grouse and their allies
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: see the chart for more information
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the classification of birds is a contentious issue
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: sibley & ahlquist's phylogeny and classification of birds 1990 is a landmark work on the classification of birds although frequently debated and constantly revised
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a preponderance of evidence seems to suggest that the modern bird orders constitute accurate taxa
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however scientists are not in agreement as to the relationships between the orders evidence from modern bird anatomy fossils and dna have all been brought to bear on the problem but no strong consensus has emerged
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: see also sibley ahlquist taxonomy
lines.name: Sundanese
