lines.value: malaria has probably infected humans for over 50000 years and may have been a human pathogen for the entire history of our species
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: indeed close relatives of the human malaria parasites remain common in chimpanzees our closest relatives
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: references to the unique periodic fevers of malaria are found throughout recorded history beginning in 2700 bc in china during the xia dynasty
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the term malaria originates from medieval italian mala aria - "bad air and the disease was formerly called ague or marsh fever due to its association with swamps
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: scientific studies on malaria made their first significant advance in 1880 when a french army doctor working in algeria named charles louis alphonse laveran observed parasites inside the red blood cells of people suffering from malaria
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: he therefore proposed that malaria was caused by this protozoan the first time protozoa were identified as causing disease
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for this and later discoveries he was awarded the 1907 nobel prize for physiology or medicine
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the protozoan was called plasmodium by the italian scientists ettore marchiafava and angelo celli
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a year later carlos finlay a cuban doctor treating patients with yellow fever in havana first suggested that mosquitoes were transmitting disease to humans
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however it was britain's sir ronald ross working in india who finally proved in 1898 that malaria is transmitted by mosquitoes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: he did this by showing that certain mosquito species transmit malaria to birds and isolating malaria parasites from the salivary glands of mosquitoes that had fed on infected birds
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for this work ross received the 1902 nobel prize in medicine
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: after resigning from the indian medical service ross worked at the newly established liverpool school of tropical medicine and directed malaria control efforts in egypt panama greece and mauritius
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the findings of finlay and ross were later confirmed by a medical board headed by walter reed in 1900 and its recommendations implemented by william c gorgas in the health measures undertaken during construction of the panama canal
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this public health work saved the lives of thousands of workers and helped develop the methods used in future public health campaigns against this disease
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the first effective treatment for malaria was the bark of cinchona tree which contains quinine
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this tree grows on the slopes of the andes mainly in peru
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this natural product was used by the inhabitants of peru to control malaria and the jesuits introduced this practice to europe during the 1640s where it was rapidly accepted
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however it was not until 1820 that the active ingredient quinine was extracted from the bark isolated and named by the french chemists pierre joseph pelletier and joseph caventou
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in the early twentieth century before antibiotics patients with syphilis were intentionally infected with malaria to create a fever
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: by accurately controlling the fever with quinine the effects of both syphilis and malaria could be minimised
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: although some patients died from malaria this was preferable than the almost certain death from syphilis
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: although the blood stage and mosquito stages of the malaria life cycle were established in the 19th and early 20th centuries it was not until the 1980s that the latent liver form of the parasite was observed
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the discovery of this latent form of the parasite finally explained why people could appear to be cured of malaria but still relapse years after the parasite had disappeared from their bloodstreams.-->
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: <!--the stickiness of the red blood cells is particularly pronounced in plasmodium falciparum malaria and this is the main factor giving rise to hemorrhagic complications of malaria
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some merozoites turn into male and female gametocytes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: if a mosquito bites the infected person and picks up gametocytes with the blood fertilization occurs in the mosquito's gut new sporozoites develop and travel to the mosquito's salivary gland completing the cycle
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: pregnant women are especially attractive to the mosquitoes and malaria in pregnant women is an important cause of still births and infant mortality
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the recognised species causing disease in humans are p falciparum which alone accounts for 80% of the recognised cases and ~90% of the deaths and p vivax but p ovale p malariae p knowesli and p semiovale are also known to cause malaria
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: mun kadiagnosa ti anggalna malaria bisa diubaran but prevention is always much better and substances that inhibit the parasite are widely used by visitors to the tropics
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: since the 17th century quinine has been the prophylactic of choice for malaria
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the development of quinacrine chloroquine and primaquine in the 20th century reduced the reliance on quinine
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these anti malarial medications can be taken preventively which is recommended for travellers to affected regions
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: certain strains of plasmodium have recently developed resistance to chloroquine which was the first line of treatment in many countries thus complicating the treatment
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in west africa where the local strains of malaria are particularly virulent mefloquine trade name lariam is now the recommended prophylactic despite causing psychological problems in some vulnerable people
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: doxycycline an antibiotic is also prescribed as a prophylactic against quinine resistant malaria though its use is less common than lariam because it must be consumed daily
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it seems inevitable that resistance to these drugs will also occur
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: malarone is also a recommended prophylactic
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in addition to the antimalarial drugs the use of mosquito repellents such as deet and mosquito nets and screens can reduce the chances of contracting malaria as well as the discomfort of insect bites
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: extracts from the plant artemisia specifically artemisia annua containing the compound artemisinin a substance unrelated to the quinine derivatives offer some future promise
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: efforts to eradicate malaria by eliminating mosquitos have been successful in some areas
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: malaria was once common in the united states and southern europe but the draining of wetland breeding grounds and better sanitation eliminated it from affluent regions
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: malaria was eliminated from the northern parts of the usa in the early twentieth century and the use of the pesticide ddt during the 1950s eliminated it from the south
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a major public health effort to eradicate malaria by selectively targeting mosquitos in areas where malaria was rampant was embarked upon in the 1950s and 1960s
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: ( the mosquito killer- pdf of the same article however these efforts ultimately failed to eradicate malaria in many parts of the developing world
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: vaccines for malaria are under development with no completely effective vaccine yet available as of november 2004
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a team backed by the gates foundation and the pharma giant glaxosmithkline announced a partially successful field trial in october 2004 for rts,s/as02a a vaccine which reduces infection risk by 30% and severity of infections by over 50%
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: further research will delay this vaccine from commercial release until around 2010
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in january 2005 edinburgh university scientists announced the discovery of an antibody which protects against the disease
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the scientists will lead a £17m european consortium of malaria researchers
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it is hoped that the genome sequence of the most deadly agent of malaria plasmodium falciparum which was completed in 2002 will provide targets for new drugs or vaccines
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: sterile insect technique is emerging as a potential method to control malaria carrying mosquitos
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: progress towards transgenic or genetically modified insects suggests that wild mosquito populations could be made malaria resistant
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: researchers at imperial college london created the world's first transgenic malaria mosquito with the first plasmodium resistant species announced by a team at case western reserve university in ohio in 2002 see jacobs lorena et al 2002)
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: since most of the deaths today occur in poor rural areas of africa which lack health care the distribution of mosquito nets impregnated with insect repellants has been suggested as the most cost effective prevention method
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these nets can often be obtained for less than us$10 or 10 euros when purchased in bulk from the united nations or other organizations
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the nets need to be reimpregnated with the chemical about every six months
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: spraying interior walls with ddt is also effective in areas where the mosquitoes are not already ddt resistant
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this public health use of small amounts of ddt is permitted under the stockholm convention on persistent organic pollutants pops which prohibits the agricultural use of ddt for large scale field spraying
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: most of the body's anabolic pathways converge on the tca cycle as the diagram shows
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: reactions that form intermediates of the cycle are called anaplerotic reactions
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the citric acid cycle is the second step in carbohydrate catabolism the breakdown of sugars
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: glycolysis breaks glucose a six carbon molecule down into pyruvate a three carbon molecule
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in eukaryotes pyruvate moves into the mitochondria
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it is converted into acetyl coa and enters the citric acid cycle
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in protein catabolism proteins are broken down by protease enzymes into their constituent amino acids
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: these amino acids are brought into the cells and can be a source of energy by being funnelled into the citric acid cycle
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in fat catabolism triglycerides are hydrolyzed to break them into fatty acids and glycerol
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in the liver the glycerol can be converted into glucose via dihydroxyacetone phosphate and glyceraldehyde 3 phosphate by way of gluconeogenesis
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in many tissues especially heart fatty acids are broken down through a process known as beta oxidation which results in acetyl coa which can be used in the citric acid cycle
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: sometimes beta oxidation can yield propionyl coa which can result in further glucose production by gluconeogenesis in liver
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the citric acid cycle is always followed by oxidative phosphorylation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this process extracts the energy from nadh and fadh 2 recreating nad + and fad so that the cycle can continue
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the citric acid cycle itself does not use oxygen but oxidative phosphorylation does
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the total energy gained from the complete breakdown of one molecule of glucose by glycolysis the citric acid cycle and oxidative phosphorylation equals about 38 atp molecules
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the citric acid cycle is called an amphibolic pathway because it participates in both catabolism and anabolism
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: wikimedia commons oge katelah commons atawa wikicommons mangrupa salah sahiji proyek yayasan wikimedia nu tujuanana salaku gudang koropak gambar sora sarta multimedia eusi bebas
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: koropak koropak nu dimuat disimpen di gudang ieu bisa dipake sakumaha koropak nu dimuat sacara lokal di server proyek-proyek wikimedia lianna kayaning wikipedia pustaka wiki jeung wikinews
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: proyek ieu diajukeun maret 2004 sarta medal 7 september 2004
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: nu jadi konci diwangunna gudang sentra ieu nyaeta sangkan ngurangan duplikasi dina tarekah ngamekarkeun proyek-proyek wikimedia katut varian basana
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: dimuatna koropak sacara lokal masih mungkin tapi ditujukeun pikeun bahan bahan nu saluyu jeung kawijakan lokal tapi teu luyu jeung kawijakan lisensi commons
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: mimiti taun 2005 wikimedia commons ngahulag dimuatna koropak make lisensi teu bebas
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: lisensi nu ditampa di antarana gnu free documentation license creative commons sarta domain publik
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: given its primary function as a supporting project for the other wikimedia web sites the main content policy for files uploaded to the commons is that they must be potentially useful on any of the wikimedia projects
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this excludes material such as purely personal pictures and artwork in contrast to image sharing repositories like flickr and deviantart
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: nevertheless large numbers of files hosted on the commons are not used directly on any wikimedia project and likely never will be as such the project has grown into a repository of multimedia in its own right which is frequently linked to from articles on wikipedia and other wikimedia websites to provide supplemental materials
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the project has grown very rapidly since its inception
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: on may 24 2005 it reached a milestone of 100000 uploaded media files excluding thousands of weather and market data images for wikinews
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it was also the first wikimedia project to use mediawiki 1.4
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the default language for the commons is english but the interface can be configured in user preferences to use any other language
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some pages have also been translated into various languages
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: files on the wikimedia commons are categorized using mediawiki's category system
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: furigana are most commonly used in works for children who may not have sufficiently advanced reading skills to recognise the kanji but can understand the word when written phonetically in hiragana
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: because children learn hiragana before katakana in books for very young children there are hiragana furigana next to the katakana characters
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it is common to use furigana on all kanji characters in works for young children
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this is called sorubi 総ルビ in japanese
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in works aimed at adult japanese speakers furigana may be used on a word written in uncommon kanji in the mass media they are generally used on words containing non joyo kanji
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: furigana commonly appear alongside kanji names and their romanizations on signs for railway stations even if the pronunciation of the kanji is commonly known
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: furigana also appear often on maps to show the pronunciation of unusual place names
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: japanese names are usually written in kanji
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: because there are many possible readings for kanji names including special name only readings called nanori furigana are often used to give the readings of names
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: on japanese official forms where the name is to be written there is always an adjacent column for the name to be written in furigana
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: usually katakana is preferred
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: furigana may also be used for foreign names written in kanji
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: chinese and korean names are the most common examples chinese names are usually pronounced with japanese readings and the pronunciation written in hiragana while korean names are usually pronounced with korean readings and the pronunciation written in katakana
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: furigana may also be necessary in the rare case where names are transliterated into kanji from other languages e.g soccer star ruy ramos and activist arudou debito
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: kanji and kanji compounds are often presented with furigana in japanese language textbooks for non native speakers
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: furigana are also often used in foreign language textbooks for japanese learners to indicate pronunciation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the words are written in the original foreign script such as hangul for korean and furigana is used to indicate the pronunciation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: some writers use furigana to represent slang pronunciations particularly those which would become hard to understand without the kanji to provide their meaning
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: another use is to write the kanji for something which had been previously referenced but write furigana for sore () or are (), meaning that indicating that the characters simply refer to it with a pronoun but clarifying for the reader what thing was meant
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in karaoke it is extremely common for furigana to be placed on the song lyrics
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the song lyrics are often written in kanji pronounced quite differently from the furigana
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the furigana version is used for pronunciation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: also because the kanji represent meaning while the furigana represent sound one can combine the two to create puns or indicate meanings of foreign words
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: one might write the kanji for blue but use katakana to write the pronunciation of the english word blue this may be done for example in japanese subtitles on foreign films where it can help associate the written japanese with the sounds actually being spoken by the actors or it may be used in a translation of a work of fiction to enable the translator to preserve the original sound of a proper name such as firebolt in the harry potter series in furigana while simultaneously indicating its meaning with kanji
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a similar practice is used in native fiction to produce double meanings for example the word for earth might be written with furigana for homeland () as the reading in a work of science fiction
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the majority of plant pathogens are fungal with ascomycetes the leading group
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: fungal plant pathogens can be described as polycyclic if the disease is capable of making spores and reinfecting plants during a growing season or monocyclic if it has to wait until a new season
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: fungal pathogens are also defined by the types of spores they create and the methods by which they enter the plant tissue
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: once the pathogen enters the plant tissue it either creates a haustorium and grows inside the living tissue biotroph or kills the surrounding cells and lives off the dead tissue necrotroph
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: indications of pathogen presence are divided into signs and symptoms
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: signs are observational evidence of the pathogen such as visible sporulation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: symptoms are secondary evidence that a pathogen is present such as wilting of the leaves
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.name: Sundanese

lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: nurunna fungsi atawa euweuhna limpa bisa ningkatkeun kadar trombosit sedengkeun hipersplenisme limpa aktif teuing misalna dina kasakit gaucher atawa leukemia ngabalukarkeun kurangna kadar trombosit
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: trombosit aktif mun diantelkeun jeung kolagen nu ngaboleklak nalika saluran getih endotel ruksak/tatu/soeh trombin utamana ngaliwatan par 1 adp with receptors expressed on white blood cells or the endothelial cells of the blood vessels among other activators
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: once activated they release a number of different coagulation factors and platelet activating factors they also provide a catalytic phospholipid surface with the charge provided by phosphatidylserine and phosphatidylethanolamine for the tenase and prothrombinase complexes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the platelets adhere to each other via adhesion receptors or integrins and to the endothelial cells in the wall of the blood vessel forming a haemostatic plug in conjunction with fibrin
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the high concentration of myosin and actin filaments in platelets are stimulated to contract during aggregation further reinforcing the plug
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the most common platelet adhesion receptor is glycoprotein gp iib/iiia this is a calcium dependent receptor for fibrinogen fibronectin vitronectin thrombospondin and von willebrand factor vwf
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: other receptors include gpib v ix complex vwf and gpvi collagen
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: trombosit bisa diaktifkeun ku rupa rupa zat di antarana
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a normal platelet count in a healthy person is between 150 and 400 x 10 9 l of blood
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: both thrombocytopenia or thrombopenia and thrombocytosis may present with coagulation problems
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: generally low platelet counts increase bleeding risks although there are exceptions e.g immune heparin induced thrombocytopenia and thrombocytosis high counts may lead to thrombosis although this is mainly when the elevated count is due to myeloproliferative disorder
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: low platelet counts are generally not corrected by transfusion unless the patient is bleeding or the count has fallen below 5 x 10 9 l it is contraindicated in thrombotic thrombocopenic purpura ttp as it fuels the coagulopathy
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in patients having surgery a level below 50 x 10 9 l is associated with abnormal surgical bleeding and regional anaesthetic procedures such as epidurals are avoided for levels below 80-100
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: note however that the actual platelet count is only part of the story since they may not all be functioning normally
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: for example aspirin irreversibly prevents platelets from working correctly and so normal hemostasis may not return until the aspirin is ceased and the affected platelets have been replaced by new ones which may take over a week
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: kalainan nu ngabalukarkeun kurangna kadar trombosit nyaeta *trombositosis kaasup benign essential thrombocytosis elevated counts either reactive or as an expression of myeloproliferative disease may feature dysfunctional platelets disorders of platelet adhesion or aggregation
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: trombosit dipisahkeun tina getih nu didonorkeun sabab trombosit gampang ruksak nalika getih disimpen dina kulkas
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: ku sabab dina suhu ieu aya resiko tumuwuhna bakteri mangka paling lila disimpenna teh ukur lima poe

lines.value: dina taun 1912 karl mutuskeun pindah ka amerika
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in america on his own he undertook an engineering tour of major dam construction sites in the west
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this was no ordinary tour but was his opportunity to gather reports and first hand knowledge of the problems of many different projects and he used it to the fullest before returning to austria in december 1913
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: when the war broke out he found himself drafted into the army as an officer directing a 250 man engineering battalion
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: his responsibilities again increased leading now 1000 men and he faced combat in serbia and witnessed the fall of belgrade
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: after a short stint managing an airfield he became a professor in the royal ottoman college of engineering in constatinople
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: here he began a happy very productive period in which he began his lifelong work of bringing true engineering understanding to soil as an engineering material whose properties could be measured in standardized ways
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: he set up a laboratory using only the most rudimentary of equipment and began his revolution
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: his measurements and analysis of the force on retaining walls were first published in english in 1919 and was quickly recognized as an important new contribution to the scientific understanding of the fundamental behavior of soils
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: at the end of the war he was forced to resign his post at the university but managed to find a new post at tiny robert college in a town just north of constantinople
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: here he switched his teaching language from french to english and again constructed a laboratory out of the most simple equipment
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this time he studied various experimental and quantitative aspects of the permeability of soils to water and was able to work out some theories to explain the observations
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: he invented entirely new apparatus for the measurements and put in many long days of work to carry out the measurements himself
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in 1924 he published much of this in his magnum opus erdbaumechanik which revolutionized the field to great acclaim
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: it resulted in a job offer from mit which he immediately accepted
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: one of his first tasks in america was to bring his work to the attention of american engineers
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this he proceeded to do by writing a series of articles for the engineering news record which were published in the winter of 1925 then as a small book in 1926
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: he found the facilities at mit abombinable and obstruction from the administration
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: he brushed these obstacles aside and once more set up a new laboratory geared to making measurements on soils with instruments of his own devising
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: he entered a new phase of prolific publication and a rapidly growing and lucrative involvement as an engineering consultant on many large scale projects
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: he was much sought after as a dinner companion and was a fascinating conversationalist
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: his striking good looks and evident power was very attractive to women
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in 1928 he met the young harvard doctoral student in geology ruth dogget and fell deeply in love
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in 1928 terzaghi was finally fed up with mit and its president and determined to return to europe
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: he accepted a chair at the vienna technische hochshule in the winter of 1929
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: he married ruth who became his editor and collaborator as well
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: a short consulting trip to russia before taking up his post horrified him and he came to oppose the communist system there as a regime exemplified by its brutality and chaos
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: using austria as his base he traveled ceaselessly throughout europe consulting and lecturing and making new professional contacts and collaborations
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: his teaching workload was now relatively light so he continued his experimental investigations and became especially interested in the problems of the settling of foundations and of grouting
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: he began writing the manuscript for a much updated and expanded version of erdbaumechanik now set for two volumes
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: however the political turmoil in austria began to interfere with his work and in 1935 he decided to take a leave from vienna during 1935 to 1936
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: he began his sabbatical with a short trip to consult with todt and the architects of the proposed grandiose plans for immense buildings at the nazi's party day rally site in nuremburg
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: this led to a conflict over the best way to lay a sound foundation which led to a discussion with hitler himself who took an intense interest in all details of the architecture
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: terzaghi then returned to america where he gave a plenary lecture at the international conference on soil mechanics at harvard university
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: he made a lecture tour of many other universities but discovered that prospects for employment were dim
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: he returned to vienna in november of 1936 shortly after the birth of his first son eric
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in vienna he returned to a nasty professional and political controversy which he overcame only with some difficulty
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: he memorably stated the fatherland denoted me as a nazi the nazis as a bolshevik and the bolsheviks as a conservative idealist
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: certainly only one of the three could be right and that one is the bolsheviks he escaped from vienna frequently by extended consulting trips to major construction projects in england italy france algeria and latvia adding greatly to his store of practical engineering experience
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in 1938 terzaghi emigrated to the united states and took up a post at harvard university
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: before the end of the war he consulted on the chicago subway system the newport news shipways construction and raising the normandie among others
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: he became an american citizen in march 1943
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: he remained as a part timer at harvard university until his retirement in 1953 at the mandatory age of 70
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: in july of the next year he became the chairman of the consulting board for the construction of the aswan high dam
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: he resigned this post in 1959 after coming into conflict with the russian engineers in charge of the project but continued to consult on various hydroelectric projects especially in british columbia
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: he died in 1963
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the american society of civil engineers established in 1960 the karl tezaghi award to an author of outstanding contributions to knowledge in the fields of soil mechanics subsurface and earthwork engineering and subsurface and earthwork construction the terzaghi and peck library which is managed by the norwegian geotechnical institute in oslo norway holds an extensive collection of his papers
lines.name: Sundanese

lines.value: the mission dam in british columbia canada was renamed his honor as the terzaghi dam in 1965
lines.name: Sundanese
